verse_data: तेन सत्येन गच्छेयं लोकान्यत्र स शंतनुः

grains, tila, meat, kulattha, mustard seeds and channs. Kalayanatha mudgas and wheat singers and so on
and the destroyer of the crops and the destroyer of another animal. He is born, sir, the mouse, the shameless.
Then, after death, O great king, the pig reborn. The pig dies as soon as the disease dies, O king.

verse_data: श्वा ततो जायते मूढः कर्मणा तेन पार्थिव
श्वा भूत्वा पञ्च वर्षाणि ततो जायति मानुषः

verse_translation.google_trans: A dog is then born a fool by action, by that earth A dog becomes five years and then a man is born

verse_data: परदाराभिमर्शं तु कृत्वा जायति वै वृकः
श्वा सृगालस्ततो गृध्रो व्यालः कङ्को बकस्तथा

verse_translation.google_trans: The wolf is born after rubbing another’s wife The dog, the fox, then the vulture, the serpent, the crow and the goat.
But he who attacks his brother’s wife, who is evil-minded, bewitched. He also attains male cuckoo, O King, for a year
The wife of a friend is the wife of the teacher and the wife of the wife Having attacked him, he was born dead, such as lust.

verse_data: सूकरः पञ्च वर्षाणि पञ्च वर्षाणि श्वाविधः

verse_translation.google_trans: The pig is five years old and the dogs are five years old The ant is for six months and the insect will be the same for the month They are born in the worms of the world by reaching them
There he lives for the months of the thirteenth worms Then the human being is born again by destroying iniquity

verse_data: उपस्थिते विवाहे तु दाने यज्ञेऽपि वाभिभो
मोहात्करोति यो विघ्नं स मृतो जायते कृमिः

verse_translation.google_trans: In the presence of marriage, however, in charity, in sacrifice, or in the sacrifice. He who causes obstacles out of delusion is dead and worm is born

verse_data: कृमिर्जीवति वर्षाणि दश पञ्च च भारत
अधर्मस्य क्षयं कृत्वा ततो जायति मानुषः

verse_translation.google_trans: The worm lives for ten and five years, India By destroying iniquity, a man is born then

verse_data: पूर्वं दत्त्वा तु यः कन्यां द्वितीये संप्रयच्छति

verse_translation.google_trans: But he who gives the daughter in the second by giving it first That too, O King, is born of the dead animal.
There he lives for thirteen years Yudhisthira Endowed with the destruction of iniquity, then a man is born.
and the work of the fathers for the sake of the gods Annivapya samashnanvai tato jayati gayasa

verse_data: वायसो दश वर्षाणि ततो जायति कुक्कुटः

verse_translation.google_trans: The crow is ten years and then the chicken is born There is also a lavaka for a month and therefore a human being
He who despises his brother as his eldest son equal to his father He too is born of death and is born in the kraunchayona

verse_data: क्रौञ्चो जीवति मासांस्तु दश द्वौ सप्त पञ्च च

verse_translation.google_trans: Crouch lives for ten months, two, seven and five. Then he attains death and attains humanity
The bull goes to the Brahmini and is born in the worms. There, the rat produces the child and then the mouse.
Ungrateful, he died and went to the subject of the king. He gets terrible to kill him in the case of Yama
Pattis, hammers, spears, fire and pots are terrible The forest of sword leaves is a terrible sand of the Kutashalmali

verse_data: एताश्चान्याश्च बह्वीः स यमस्य विषयं गतः

verse_translation.google_trans: These and many others have gone to the subject of Yama Receives torments there and then kills India

verse_data: कृमिर्भवति वर्षाणि दश पञ्च च भारत
ततो गर्भं समासाद्य तत्रैव म्रियते शिशुः

verse_translation.google_trans: The world cycle reaches the worms and is born The worm is ten and five years old India Then the child dies and dies there
Then the animals are born with hundreds of pregnancy and the worlds are many and then it is born of the sacrifice
Dead to suffer for many years here Then the tortoise is born without repetition

verse_data: अर्थार्थी यदि वा वैरी स मृतो जायते खरः

verse_translation.google_trans: He killed a man without weapons and a armed man armed. If he seeks wealth or if he is an enemy, he is dead and is born as a donkey

verse_data: खरो जीवति वर्षे द्वे ततः शस्त्रेण वध्यते

verse_translation.google_trans: The donkey lives in the year and then kills the weapon He is dead in the womb of a deer and is always agitated

verse_data: मृगो वध्यति शस्त्रेण गते संवत्सरे तु सः
हतो मृगस्ततो मीनः सोऽपि जालेन बध्यते

verse_translation.google_trans: The deer kills the weapon in the year but he is The deer killed then the fish is bound by the net

verse_data: श्वापदो दश वर्षाणि द्वीपी वर्षाणि पञ्च च

verse_translation.google_trans: When the fourth month is reached, the dog is born Dogs ten years of island and five years

verse_data: अधर्मस्य क्षयं कृत्वा ततो जायति मानुषः

verse_translation.google_trans: Then he died and was inspired by time By destroying iniquity, a man is born then

verse_data: स्त्रियं हत्वा तु दुर्बुद्धिर्यमस्य विषयं गतः

verse_translation.google_trans: But after killing a woman, the evil-minded man went to the subject of him Having attained many troubles and twenty worlds
Then, afterwards, O King, the two worms are born The worm is born for twenty years and is born a human being

verse_data: भोजनं चोरयित्वा तु मक्षिका जायते नरः

verse_translation.google_trans: A man becomes a fly after stealing food The fly was subdued for many months Then he becomes a human being by destroying sins

verse_data: वाद्यं हृत्वा तु पुरुषो मशकः संप्रजायते
स जायते बभ्रुसमो दारुणो मूषको नरः

verse_translation.google_trans: But the man who takes the instrument is born of the mosquito and the man should steal the mixture of the pinyakas. He is born like a beaver, a terrible mouse man.
Salt steals and the chirivaka is born The duck and the duck are the floats and the fish-cultivations
stealing milk and strength But he who steals oil is born of oil. But after stealing, the evil-minded honey is born with a bite.

verse_data: अयो हृत्वा तु दुर्बुद्धिर्वायसो जायते नरः

verse_translation.google_trans: A man who takes away the evil-minded man is born a crow He steals the payasam and attains the tittiri.

verse_data: फलं वा मूलकं हृत्वा अपूपं वा पिपीलिकः

verse_translation.google_trans: She takes away the paisht and the bread and is born of the pot owl The fruit or the root is taken by the bread or the ant is the ant

verse_data: कांस्यं हृत्वा तु दुर्बुद्धिर्हारीतो जायते नरः

verse_translation.google_trans: A man who takes away bronze is a bad-minded man who is lost A pigeon is born and takes away a silver vessel

verse_data: हृत्वा तु काञ्चनं भाण्डं कृमियोनौ प्रजायते
क्रौञ्चः कार्पासिकं हृत्वा मृतो जायति मानवः

verse_translation.google_trans: The golden vessel is taken away and the worms are born The krauncha takes away the cotton and dies when he dies

verse_data: चोरयित्वा नरः पट्टं त्वाविकं वापि भारत
क्षौमं च वस्त्रमादाय शशो जन्तुः प्रजायते

verse_translation.google_trans: A man who steals a patch or twavik, India Taking silk clothes, the rabbit is born.

verse_data: वर्णान्हृत्वा तु पुरुषो मृतो जायति बर्हिणः

verse_translation.google_trans: But the man who takes away the castes is dead and is born peacock A living being is born with a living being who takes away red clothes
The human being steals the colors and other objects He attains the Chuchhundaritva, O King, the greedy one.

verse_data: विश्वासेन तु निक्षिप्तं यो निह्नवति मानवः

verse_translation.google_trans: But the man who despises it by faith He is born of a man who has lost his life and is born in the womb of a fish
After reaching the Matsyayoni, a man is born and is born. Having attained humanity, the length of life is attained.

verse_data: पापानि तु नरः कृत्वा तिर्यग्जायति भारत
न चात्मनः प्रमाणं ते धर्मं जानन्ति किंचन

verse_translation.google_trans: But a man who commits sins is born of the Tiryaga, India And they do not know the Dharma of the Self.

verse_data: ये पापानि नराः कृत्वा निरस्यन्ति व्रतैः सदा

verse_translation.google_trans: Those men who commit sins are always rejected by vows They are sick and sick with pleasure and pain
There is no doubt that the mlecchas are born without dwellings Men are sinful, greedy for greed and delusion.

verse_data: वर्जयन्ति च पापानि जन्मप्रभृति ये नराः

verse_translation.google_trans: And men who avoid sins from birth They are healthy and beautiful and rich
Women also commit sin by doing this Kalpa They become the wives of these same animals
All the faults are mentioned in the removal of others This is what I have told you, O sinless one. In the other story, you will hear it again, India.
I have spoken this, O great king, in the past. The gods and sages heard in the middle as they were

verse_data: एतच्छ्रुत्वा महाराज धर्मे कुरु मनः सदा

verse_translation.google_trans: I have also described to you as you have done Hearing this, O great king, do your mind always
Yudhisthira said

verse_data: धर्मस्य तु गतिं श्रोतुमिच्छामि वदतां वर
कृत्वा कर्माणि पापानि कथं यान्ति शुभां गतिम्

verse_translation.google_trans: The path of iniquity, O Brahman, has told me, O sinless one I wish to hear the path of righteousness, O best of speakers How do you go to the good destination of sins committing committing sins
Brihaspati said
Having committed sins, he came under the control of iniquity The mind is reversed in the opposite direction
He who has done iniquity out of delusion and repents again He who is associated with the mind and samadhi should not serve the wicked
As a man speaks of the right religion He is freed from the concentrated mind and so on Like a snake, free from liberation from the past and old.
Even if he does not give gifts, he is concentrated in various ways He who is associated with the mind and samadhi attains good fortune

verse_data: प्रदानानि तु वक्ष्यामि यानि दत्त्वा युधिष्ठिर

verse_translation.google_trans: I will tell you the gifts which you have given to Yudhisthira A man who does not do anything is then fitted by righteousness
Food is the best of all gifts. The first food should be given to the man who desires righteousness
The life-force is the food of men and the animals are born of him The worlds are established in food and therefore the food shines
The gods, sages, fathers and humans praise food itself For by giving food, Kausika attains heaven
It is the best food to be given to the Brāhmaṇas who have obtained justice The self-studying, the cheerful inner self, the inner self.

verse_data: हृष्टेन मनसा दत्तं न स तिर्यग्गतिर्भवेत्

verse_translation.google_trans: whose food is eaten by ten hundred Brahmins He who has given him with a cheerful mind will not be oblique.
Ten thousands of Brahmins, O best of men, A man is freed from iniquity always engaged in sins
The brahmin, who was rewarded by the Vedas, collected the food with alms. Gives a brahmin devoted to his study and enjoys happiness here
and protecting the Brahmins daily by justice He who gives food received by the kshatriya levels
He was carefully concentrated on the twins and the elders of the Vedas By this the righteous man removes evil deeds, O Pandava.
Sixth part is pure and the part of the agriculture is earned The Vaishya gives to the brahmins and the sins of the twice-born
Avapy prana sandhom karkasyena samarjitam A Sudra who gives food to the twins is freed from sin

verse_data: यः प्रयच्छति विप्रेभ्यो न स दुर्गाणि सेवते

verse_translation.google_trans: Aursena forced food and violently He who gives to the brahmins does not serve the fortresses
A man who has received food by justice is devoid of greed Giving to the Brāhmaṇas and the elders of the Vedas is freed from sin
A man who gives food and urine in the world will become bruth Relying on the path of the virtuous, he is freed from all sins.

verse_data: दानकृद्भिः कृतः पन्था येन यान्ति मनीषिणः
ते स्म प्राणस्य दातारस्तेभ्यो धर्मः सनातनः

verse_translation.google_trans: The paths made by the charitable men by which the sages go They were the givers of life and their religion to them

verse_data: कार्यं पात्रगतं नित्यमन्नं हि परमा गतिः

verse_translation.google_trans: In all circumstances, a man has earned food according to justice. The work in the vessel is eternal food for the ultimate destination is the ultimate goal

verse_data: अन्नस्य हि प्रदानेन नरो दुर्गं न सेवते

verse_translation.google_trans: For by giving food, a man does not serve the fortress Therefore, food should be given, devoid of injustice.
Yated brahmana purvaam hi bhotnam ghari sada sada sada A man should make a day innocent by giving food
Feeding ten hundred men, O King, for the Vedic scholars. and the judges of the law and the historians.

verse_data: न याति नरकं घोरं संसारांश्च न सेवते

verse_translation.google_trans: He does not go to hell and does not serve the terrible world He who is endowed with all desires and enjoys the fruit after death
Thus he enjoys happiness and enjoys free fever It is beautiful and famed and rich in wealth
This is the great fruit of giving all this to you This is the root of the giving of religions, India
Yudhisthira said

verse_data: तपोऽथ गुरुशुश्रूषा किं श्रेयः पुरुषं प्रति

verse_translation.google_trans: Non-violence is Vedic action, meditation is restraint of the senses Tapas then serving the Guru, what is better to the man.
Brihaspati said
All these are the separate gates of religion in all respects Listen to the six, O Bharatarshabha.

verse_data: अहिंसापाश्रयं धर्मं यः साधयति वै नरः

verse_translation.google_trans: Oh, I shall tell you the best of the best of the living beings. A man who accomplishes the religion of non-violence
A man always placed the three evils in all beings He then restrains lust and anger and then attains perfection

verse_data: आत्मनः सुखमन्विच्छन्न स प्रेत्य सुखी भवेत्

verse_translation.google_trans: He who kills the non-violent beings with punishment He who seeks the happiness of himself will be happy after death

verse_data: आत्मोपमश्च भूतेषु यो वै भवति पूरुषः

verse_translation.google_trans: and in beings like the Self, who is the man He who has laid his punishment and has conquered anger prosperates happily after death
Seeing all beings of the Self of all beings Even the gods are deluded by the footsteps of disasters
No one should give to the other who is opposed to the self. This is brief religion, and another is invoked by lust

verse_data: प्रत्याख्याने च दाने च सुखदुःखे प्रियाप्रिये

verse_translation.google_trans: In rejection and charity, in pleasure and pain, dear and unpleasant By self-likeness a man attains samadhi

verse_data: यथा परः प्रक्रमतेऽपरेषु; तथापरः प्रक्रमते परस्मिन्
एषैव तेऽस्तूपमा जीवलोके; यथा धर्मो नैपुणेनोपदिष्टः

verse_translation.google_trans: as the other proceeds in others;and another proceeds in the other This is the same instance in the world of living beings;as the religion taught by the skilled
Vaishampayana said
Having said this, the teacher of the gods, Yudhisthira, the king of Dharma. Divamacakrame, the wise, see us then.
Vaishampayana said
Then King Yudhisthira, the grandfather of the autumn bed. Again, the mighty man asked the bridegroom.
The sages, the Brahmins, the gods, praise the great soul The Dharma characterized by non-violence is from the view of the authenticity of the Vedas

verse_data: वाचा च मनसा चैव कथं दुःखात्प्रमुच्यते

verse_translation.google_trans: By action man does violence, O best of the earthly ones. How is he freed from suffering by words and minds
Bhishma said
The four kinds of non-violence are designated by the Brahmaists This is not deviated from one of them, O destroyer of enemies
as all four-legged does not stand in three legs This is the ruler of the king by three reasons

verse_data: एवं लोकेष्वहिंसा तु निर्दिष्टा धर्मतः परा

verse_translation.google_trans: as the other steps in the serpent step. All the others are studied in the footsteps of the Keunjara Thus, violence in the worlds is designated by religion.

verse_data: कर्मणा लिप्यते जन्तुर्वाचा च मनसैव च

verse_translation.google_trans: The animal is tainted by action and by the mind and by the mind

verse_data: पूर्वं तु मनसा त्यक्त्वा तथा वाचाथ कर्मणा

verse_translation.google_trans: Formerly, however, by the mind, and by the words, then, by the action, The triple cause, however, is indicated by the Brahmaists.
The faults of the mind and taste are established in these The wise do not eat meat, so the wise are ascetics
But listen to me here, O king, in eating the faults. He who knows that he is unconscious knows the flesh of his son.

verse_data: रसं च प्रति जिह्वायाः प्रज्ञानं जायते तथा

verse_translation.google_trans: In the combination of parents, sonhood is born as a son. And the tongue is the wisdom of the taste. and the determination of the scriptures should be tasted from the taste
They are uncultured and cultivated salt and salt The mind is suppressed as emotions are perceived

verse_data: निषेविष्यन्ति वै मन्दा मांसभक्षाः कथं नराः

verse_translation.google_trans: Bherishaṅkhamṛdaṅga and others and abundant words How can men eat slow flesh
and unthinkable and unspecified and unconceived The tastes are overwhelmed by the greedy for the taste. Praise is the same as the fruits of the faults and actions of meat

verse_data: जीवितं हि परित्यज्य बहवः साधवो जनाः

verse_translation.google_trans: For many saintly people have given up their lives They took care of the flesh of the parames by their own flesh and went to heaven
Thus, O great king, is surrounded by four reasons Non-violence is the code of all religions and artha.
Yudhisthira said
Non-violence is the supreme religion you have said often And in the shraddhas, you say that the ancestors are seeking abundance
You have spoken of the ritual of Shraddha in many ways by meat And where is the meat of the killing and where is it contradicted

verse_data: जातो नः संशयो धर्मे मांसस्य परिवर्जने

verse_translation.google_trans: Born in the avoidance of meat in religion in religion Who is the fault of eating and who is the quality of eating

verse_data: हन्याद्वा यः परस्यार्थे क्रीत्वा वा भक्षयेन्नरः

verse_translation.google_trans: killing or eating or with others. or whoever buys or eats for the sake of another
I want this in fact, O sinless one. I will certainly do this eternal religion
How does he attain life and how he becomes a Sattva How is it that she is characterized by unexpression
Bhishma said

verse_data: तं मे शृणु यथातत्त्वं यश्चास्य विधिरुत्तमः

verse_translation.google_trans: The king is iniquity in eating meat, Kurupungava. Hear me as it is true and the best of his methods
Form, unmanifest life, intelligence, Sattva, strength and memory Violence by men who desire to attain is forbidden by the self

verse_data: बभूव तेषां तु मतं यत्तच्छृणु युधिष्ठिर

verse_translation.google_trans: The dialogue here of the sages is often Kurupungava It became their opinion, but listen to what Yudhisthira
He who performs the sacrifice of the Ashwamedha in the month of Yatavrata Avoid honey and meat equally, Yudhisthira
The seven sages Valakhilya and also Marichipa The wise praise the king who eats meat.

verse_data: न भक्षयति यो मांसं न हन्यान्न च घातयेत्

verse_translation.google_trans: He who does not eat or kill meat or kill him Manu, the son of Svayambhu, said to that friend of all beings
Unbearable to all beings in all beings It should always be consented to the saintly persons from the avoidance of meat
He who wants to enhance his own flesh by the other meat Narada said, the righteous man is depressed.

verse_data: ददाति यजते चापि तपस्वी च भवत्यपि

verse_translation.google_trans: He gives and performs sacrifices and becomes an ascetic He said that he was withdrawn from honey and meat and thus he was Brihaspati

verse_data: मासि मास्यश्वमेधेन यो यजेत शतं समाः
न खादति च यो मांसं सममेतन्मतं मम

verse_translation.google_trans: He who sacrifices for a hundred equals in a month of Ashwamedha And he who does not eat meat is equal to me

verse_data: सदा यजति सत्रेण सदा दानं प्रयच्छति

verse_translation.google_trans: He always performs sacrifices by the satra always gives charity He is always an ascetic from the avoidance of honey meat

verse_data: सर्वे वेदा न तत्कुर्युः सर्वयज्ञाश्च भारत

verse_translation.google_trans: All the Vedas do not do that and all sacrifices, O India He who eats and ceases afterwards
It is difficult to avoid meat by a taster of taste This is the best vow to observe all living beings.

verse_data: दाता भवति लोके स प्राणानां नात्र संशयः

verse_translation.google_trans: He who gives the gift of fear of fear in all beings He is the giver in the world, there is no doubt about the lives of life.

verse_data: एवं वै परमं धर्मं प्रशंसन्ति मनीषिणः

verse_translation.google_trans: Thus the sages praise the supreme religion The life-force is as desired by the souls of the beings.
The wise and great souls should go by the likeness of the self There is fear of death for those who desire prosperity
What about those who are killed by the quick-life-seeking seekers They are healthy and sinful, sinful by meat and subsistence

verse_data: धर्मस्यायतनं श्रेष्ठं स्वर्गस्य च सुखस्य च

verse_translation.google_trans: Therefore know, O great king, to avoid meat. The abode of righteousness is the best of heaven and happiness

verse_data: अहिंसा परमं सत्यं ततो धर्मः प्रवर्तते

verse_data: कर्मणा मनसा वाचा त्रिविधं हि नरः सदा

verse_translation.google_trans: By what virtue or what kind of action, O God, Humans go to heaven with news, virtues, words and words
Maheshwara said
O Goddess, who knows the truth of religion and wealth, who is truthful and who is devoted to truth. Listen to the question of all living beings.
They are devoted to truth and righteousness and are devoid of all desires No doubt cut off by iniquity or righteousness
They are omniscient and equally seen by the origin of the origin of doom The men are freed from all bondage by all the bonds

verse_data: कर्मणा मनसा वाचा ये न हिंसन्ति किंचन

verse_translation.google_trans: Those who do not hurt by action, mind and words. Those who are not attached to someone are not bound by actions
They are deviated from the fall of their lives and are characterized by compassion Equal-hating-loving, self-controlled, freed from the bonds of action.
They are the compassionate ones of all beings and are faithful in all beings Those men who have given up violence are the ones who go to heaven
They are always free from the other wives of others. Those men who enjoy the purpose obtained by religion are heavenly.
They are like mothers and sisters and always like their daughters Those men who are in other wives go to heaven
They were constantly satisfied with their wealth and with their own wealth Those men who live for their own fortunes go to heaven
and those who are engaged in their wives and those who go to the seasons They are the enjoyers of the pleasures and pleasures and go to heaven
Those who are always in character covered with character in other wives Those who are devoted to the senses and who are devoted to virtue go to heaven

verse_data: एष देवकृतो मार्गः सेवितव्यः सदा नरैः

He is endowed with charity, religion and austerities and is characterized by virtue. Men should always serve for the sake of religion or for the sake of religion They should not be served by those who desire heavenly abode

Maheshwara said

These men are seen as experts They are endowed with knowledge and science and are wise in economics Others are evil-minded, O God, devoid of knowledge and science.

Brahmins and the Vedic scholars and the knowers of religion They ask for every day, skilled and unskilled.

Maheshwara said
O knower of the paravara, the knower of religion, the inhabitant of the Tapovan. Sadhvi, beautiful eyebrows, at the end of the beautiful hair, O son of the Himalayas.
